extendedIngredients.name: granny smith apple
extendedIngredients.original: 2 medium Granny Smith or other tart, firm apples (1 pound total), peeled, cored, and cut into 1 1/2-inch wedges
extendedIngredients.originalName: Granny Smith or other tart, firm apples (1 pound total), peeled, cored, and cut into 1 1/2-inch wedges

extendedIngredients.name: onion
extendedIngredients.original: 1 large onion, peeled and cut into 1 1/2-inch wedges

extendedIngredients.name: red cabbage
extendedIngredients.original: 1 small (1 1/2 pounds) red cabbage, cored and cut into 1 1/2-inch wedges through the core

title: Cook the Book: Braised Red Cabbage with Caramelized Apples
summary: Cook the Book: Braised Red Cabbage with Caramelized Apples is a gluten free and vegetarian side dish. This recipe serves 6 and costs 81 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains around 2g of protein, 12g of fat, and a total of 245 calories. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. Head to the store and pick up sugar, coarse salt, granny smith, and a few other things to make it today. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 34%. This score is not so great. Try Cook the Book: Endives, Apples, and Grapes, Cook the Book: Caramelized Orange Cheesecake, and Cook the Book: Braised Carrots for similar recipes.
instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Melt butter in a medium stockpot or Dutch oven (at least 11 inches in diameter) over medium-high heat. Add sugar and salt, and stir to dissolve.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Add apples and onion, in as close to a single layer as possible. Turn to coat in butter mixture. Let cook, shaking pan occasionally and turning over once, until sugar is beginning to caramelize and coat the apples and onions, about 10 minutes.                                                                                                                            3                                                                            Add cabbage, vinegar and water. Bring to just under a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook until cabbage is tender and liquid is reduced to a syrup, 25 to 30 minutes. (If necessary, remove lid in the last five minutes and cook uncovered to reduce liquid to desired consistency; most of the apples will disintegrate.)                                                                                                                            4                                                                            Transfer cabbage and apples to a bowl and serve immediately.

steps.step: Melt butter in a medium stockpot or Dutch oven (at least 11 inches in diameter) over medium-high heat.
Add sugar and salt, and stir to dissolve.
Add apples and onion, in as close to a single layer as possible. Turn to coat in butter mixture.
Let cook, shaking pan occasionally and turning over once, until sugar is beginning to caramelize and coat the apples and onions, about 10 minutes.

Add cabbage, vinegar and water. Bring to just under a boil. Reduce to a simmer, cover, and cook until cabbage is tender and liquid is reduced to a syrup, 25 to 30 minutes. (If necessary, remove lid in the last five minutes and cook uncovered to reduce liquid to desired consistency; most of the apples will disintegrate.)
Transfer cabbage and apples to a bowl and serve immediately.
